Description of incident: A man was sentenced to six years in prison for his role in an identity theft scheme.  The man and an unknown number of accomplices somehow obtained the personal information of people who had Flexible Spending Accounts administered by United Healthcare Inc.  The group then created counterfeit prescriptions for controlled substances by using the information of patients covered by a prescription drug plan sponsored by the Federal Employees Health Benefit Plan. The group sold the prescribed drugs to third parties from September 2008 through April 2009.  The Federal Employees Health Benefit Plan lost $72,746 on drugs and services obtained by the criminals.
